text:
Hi all,

I'm new to here. Please help me to show the hubdb columns on reverse order on the page

I Wrote like this
for row in hubdb_table_rows('3691896', '&orderBy=-reverse')

But it's not working

Kindly help me

Is there no filter for adjusting a color, i.e. darken/lighten? So if I have a primary color set up in global theme settings, I can do like `--color-primary-darken-10: {{ theme.global_colors.primary_color.color|darken(10) }}` ?

Hey there, <#C2YH119N2|hubl> group. I'm trying to create an IF statement using HUBL. But my IF statement has a little complexity. I need one IF statement that checks different conditions. This is by no means HUBL language, I'm trying to show what I'm attempting to code:
`if (row.name == 'Product A' AND rebate.value >= 32) OR (row.name == 'Product B' AND rebate.value >= 32) { then do this} else { do this other thing}`
I can't figure out how to combine conditionals using the HUBL syntax. Or is this not possible with HUBL? Thanks!
Well, the pseudo code makes sense to me as well, my problem is I can't figure out how to use the HUBL syntax to actually code it. Anything I've tried so far is telling me the syntax is not correct.
`{% if (row.name == 'Product A' and rebate.value >= 32) or (row.name == 'Product B and rebate.value >= 32) ... do thing ... else ... do thing ... %} {% endif %}` is throwing a syntax error
If you can't use `( )`, then how does one combine the conditional? Sorry, I'm a HUBL newbie.
You could put your `rebate.value >= 32` in an if outside as its the same for both

<@U021H3TV338> It is actually a function called `color_variant(hex, posOrNegInt)`

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#color_variant>
<@U011YHRTQDT> <@U021H3TV338>â€™s statement here should work for you
Hi Stephanie, just wondering if you were able to find a solution for this? I am trying to do something similar with the header module changing the font color style.

Idk if this is _exactly_ how you're writing it, but there are a couple of syntactical issues
1. There's no closing `'` after `'Product B`
2. You want to have the `%}` at the end of the "if"  token, not after the logic.
Try:

```{% if (row.name == 'Product A' and rebate.value >= 32) or (row.name == 'Product B' and rebate.value >= 32) %}... do thing ... {% else %} ... do other thing ...  {% endif %}```
Sorry, just saw the above reply. Dustin's response is also correct
Oh true, duh! Thanks, that was silly of me lol!
